summary: Build an Android WhatsApp-like online chat app with a distinct premium UI, named "Private Chat" (package: com.private.chat).
architectural_notes: App is an online messaging/chat application (WhatsApp-like core functionality).
UI must be best-in-class/premium and clearly different from WhatsApp.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Minimal premium wordmark logo, abstract lock+chat motif, dark-on-light and light-on-dark compatible (private-chat-logo.dim_1024x256.png)
- App icon with abstract lock+chat symbol, no text (private-chat-icon.dim_512x512.png)
- Empty state illustration: modern minimal chat scene with privacy motif, flat/vector style (private-chat-empty-state.dim_1200x800.png)

existing_features.title: Create the app shell and branding for an app named “Private Chat”, and ensure the UI copy uses English throughout.
Implement authentication using Internet Identity and gate chat features behind sign-in.
Frontend: build a premium, WhatsApp-different chat UI with a coherent visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, components) applied consistently across all screens.
Frontend: implement Chat List screen showing existing 1:1 threads, last message preview, last activity time, and an unread indicator (if available), with navigation into a thread.
Frontend: implement Chat Thread screen with message bubbles, timestamps, and a composer to send messages; use optimistic UI for sending and polling to refresh.
Frontend + Backend: add a simple user profile setup so users can set a display name, and show display names in chat list and thread header.
Add basic safety and quality constraints: message size limits, input sanitization for display, and graceful error states/toasts for failed network actions.
Add generated static image assets for branding and empty states, and render them from the frontend as static files (do not serve images from the backend).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create "Private Chat" (com.private.chat): WhatsApp-like online chatting app with a premium, distinct UI
Backend: implement core data models and access control for private chats (1:1 threads) and messages, ensuring only thread participants can read/send messages.
Backend: implement APIs for chat list and message history with pagination suitable for polling (no real-time sockets), including timestamps and stable ordering.
